author: coldjack (Guest)
title: o2 settings
text:
Hello,
I have installed on Ubuntu berry4all. I would like to use my BlackBerry Bold 9000 as a modem. As I have o2 contract. Can someone tell me the exact settings to the provider?
coldjack

author: Trungus (Guest)
title: Curve 8520 - Claro Argentina - disconnect after a few seconds
text:
Hi people, this is my first time trying to tether my BB, I copy the claro-do config and change the APN, user and pass but my BB disconnect after a few second after start and I never see the modem in connected state.

Files:

========
claro-ar
========
#460800
115200
defaultroute
noipdefault
#nomultilink
ipcp-restart 7
ipcp-accept-local
ipcp-accept-remote
lcp-echo-interval 0
lcp-echo-failure 99
nopcomp
noaccomp
#noauth
nomagic
noccp
crtscts
pap-timeout 20
pap-restart 20
lcp-restart 10
#novj
user "clarogprs"
password "clarogprs999"
usepeerdns

#debug debug debug
# does not exist in all pppd versions (osx)
replacedefaultroute

# replace <user> with your user name. As of Ubuntu 11.04, you must use the full path.
connect "/usr/sbin/chat -f ./conf/claro-chat"

text:

a little help would be appreciated

thank you

author: Guest (Guest)
title: My 2 cents.
text: Got it working with Blackberry Storm 9530 on Verizon, with Ubuntu Lucid 10.04. Just followed the directions and entered my phone number in the verizon configuration file in the "conf" folder. Although the actuall log in and log off procedure is quite slow compared to "Barry 0.16" on Ubuntu Jaunty 9.04, which worked flawlessly. I with Jaunty was LTS... I'm considering going back to it just for barry... I need my mobile net... all I have.

author: Berto (Guest)
title: Virgin Mobile USA?
text: Anyone know how to tether to Virgin Mobile USA with a BlackBerry Curve 8530?  Virgin Mobile USA would fall under "Sprint Pre-Paid" plans, although they now have unlimited plans for cheap too.  Thanks!

author: Guest (Guest)
title: improving speed
text: i found that by turning off verbose logging, I can get tether speeds that are almost 5x faster (1.1mbit down vs. 0.20mbit on speedtest.net).  With logging off, I'm finally getting speeds comparable to tethering in Windows.  It might just be my laptop is old (1.4ghz centrino) but Thibaut maybe you might want to turn down the verbosity by default.  Great job!

author: Guest (Guest)
title: ATT File replacement
text:
I had a little trouble getting this to work on Blackberry Bold, ATT, Ubuntu 10.04.  I modified the conf/att to the following and now it works.

# Tested on Blackberry Bold, Ubuntu 10.04
115200
#nomultilink
pap-timeout 20
pap-restart 20
lcp-restart 10
noauth
user ""
password ""

defaultroute
usepeerdns

noipdefault
nodetach
nobsdcomp
noaccomp
nocrtscts
nopcomp
nomagic
noccp
#novj

passive

ipcp-restart 7
ipcp-accept-local
ipcp-accept-remote
lcp-echo-interval 0
lcp-echo-failure 999

mtu 1492


#crtscts
#debug debug debug
# does not exist in all pppd versions (osx)
#replacedefaultroute

connect "/usr/sbin/chat -f conf/att-chat"

author: Guest (Guest)
title: AT&T
text:
In order for the AT&T script to work, I had to modify 
conf/att
The username and password can't be blank, so I just set them to 
user "user"
password "password"

and it worked. Turns out that I dont need any berry4all python wrappers, I can launch the pppd daemon directly.
